newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila water body approves privatisation bid rules.
newsitem.headline: Manila water body approves privatisation bid rules.

text.p: The board of Philippine state-owned Metropolitan Waterworks and Sewerage System (MWSS) has approved the bidding rules for the two concessions to run Manila's water system, considered the largest water privatisation in a developing country.

Mark Dumol, chief of staff of the Department of Public Works and Highways, told Reuters on Friday the bidders would have to offer a price of less than the existing average water tariff of about 8.78 pesos per cubic metre.
Four foreign companies and seven local firms have already been prequalified to join the bidding.

The foreign firms are Anglian Water Plc and Northwest Water of Britain, and France's Lyonnaise des Eaux SA and Compagnie Generale des Eaux. Dumol said the last two are considered the biggest water operators in the world.
The shortlisted local companies are Ayala Land Inc, Benpres Holdings Corp, Metro Pacific Corp, Aboitiz Equity Ventures Inc, House of Investments, J.G. Summit Holdings Inc, and Filinvest Land Inc.
